definitions: characterized by or allowing the existence of multiple different viewpoints, cultures, or belief systems within society
examples: The pluralistic society welcomed people from various backgrounds
Our school promotes a pluralistic approach to education

definitions: made of or having a soft, thick, luxurious fabric or material
richly luxurious and expensive in furnishing, decoration, or atmosphere
examples: The plush carpet felt wonderful under bare feet
She sank into the plush velvet sofa
They stayed at a plush hotel overlooking the ocean
The restaurant had plush interiors with gold accents

definitions: operated by or filled with compressed air for mechanical purposes
having a full, rounded shape like something inflated with air
examples: The pneumatic drill made quick work of concrete
Workers used pneumatic tools for construction
The actress had a pneumatic figure that drew attention
His pneumatic cheeks puffed when he played trumpet

definitions: taken or hunted illegally from protected areas or private property
cooked by simmering gently in liquid just below boiling point
examples: Rangers found poached elephant tusks in the truck
The poached rhinos were discovered by park officials
She ordered poached eggs on toast for breakfast
The poached salmon was tender and flavorful

definitions: having qualities characteristic of poetry such as beauty, imagination, or emotional intensity
expressing ideas in an imaginative and beautiful way typical of poetry
examples: His poetic language captivated the audience
The sunset created a poetic scene over the lake
She had a poetic way of describing everyday things
The film's poetic imagery won critical acclaim

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of poetry or poets in style or expression
examples: His poetical works were published posthumously
She studied poetical devices in English class

definitions: evoking a keen sense of sadness, regret, or emotional pain in a touching way
having a sharp, pungent quality in taste or smell
examples: The movie's poignant ending left everyone in tears
Her poignant memories of childhood moved listeners
The poignant aroma of spices filled the kitchen
The wine had a poignant aftertaste

definitions: having a sharp or tapered tip or end that narrows to a point
clearly directed at someone or something in a deliberate and often critical way
examples: The pointed stick could be dangerous to children
She wore shoes with pointed toes
His pointed remarks about her work upset her
The teacher made a pointed comment about tardiness

definitions: having no purpose, meaning, or likelihood of success making it not worth doing
examples: It seemed pointless to continue the failed experiment
Their pointless arguing was getting them nowhere

definitions: balanced and ready to move or act at any moment
showing calm confidence and grace in manner or bearing
examples: The cat sat poised to pounce on the mouse
The dancers were poised on their toes
She remained poised despite the difficult questions
The poised speaker impressed the audience

definitions: containing or producing poison that can cause illness or death if consumed
extremely harmful, malicious, or destructive in effect or influence
examples: The poisonous mushrooms looked like edible ones
Keep poisonous chemicals away from children
Their poisonous relationship was destroying both of them
He spread poisonous rumors about his rival

definitions: moving or progressing at an annoyingly slow pace that causes delays
uncomfortably small, cramped, or confined in space
examples: The pokey old car held up traffic on the highway
Service at the restaurant was pokey tonight
They lived in a pokey apartment downtown
The pokey office had barely room for a desk

definitions: relating to or located at the North or South Pole or regions near them
completely opposite in character, nature, or tendency
examples: Polar bears live in Arctic regions
The polar expedition faced extreme weather
They held polar opposite views on politics
The twins had polar personalities

definitions: of or involving strongly critical, controversial, or disputatious writing or speech
examples: His polemic article attacked government policies
The book was a polemic work against capitalism

definitions: relating to or involving strongly worded controversial argument or dispute about opinions
examples: The polemical essay sparked heated debate
Her polemical style alienated moderate readers

definitions: made smooth and shiny by rubbing or chemical action
refined, sophisticated, or skillful through practice and experience
examples: The polished marble floor reflected the lights
Her polished shoes gleamed in the sun
His polished presentation impressed the investors
The polished performer never missed a note

definitions: having or showing behavior that is respectful and considerate of other people
examples: The polite child always said please and thank you
It's polite to wait your turn in line

definitions: showing good judgment and diplomacy in dealing with people or situations tactfully
examples: It was politic to avoid controversial topics at dinner
His politic response satisfied both parties

definitions: contaminated with harmful or poisonous substances that make it unclean or unsafe
examples: The polluted river killed all the fish
Polluted air made breathing difficult in the city

definitions: practicing or involving marriage to more than one spouse at the same time
examples: Some cultures have polygamous marriage traditions
The polygamous relationship required careful balance

definitions: knowing, using, or written in several different languages fluently
examples: The polyglot diplomat spoke six languages fluently
The polyglot dictionary included translations in twelve languages

definitions: having the shape of a polygon with many straight sides and angles
examples: The polygonal building had an unusual geometric design
Ancient fortresses often had polygonal defensive walls

definitions: relating to or characterized by belief in or worship of multiple gods or deities
examples: Ancient Greek religion was polytheistic with many gods
The polytheistic culture had temples for different deities

definitions: containing more than one double or triple bond between carbon atoms in fatty acid molecules
examples: Polyunsaturated fats are found in fish and nuts
The doctor recommended polyunsaturated oils for cooking

definitions: affectedly and irritatingly grand, solemn, or self-important in manner or speech
examples: His pompous speech bored the audience
The pompous official looked down on everyone

definitions: engaged in deep or serious thought about something carefully and at length
examples: She sat pondering the meaning of life
His pondering expression showed deep concentration

definitions: slow and clumsy because of great weight or bulk
dull, laborious, or excessively solemn in speech or manner
examples: The elephant's ponderous movements shook the ground
The ponderous machinery required careful operation
His ponderous lecture put students to sleep
The book's ponderous style made it hard to read

definitions: exciting, lively, or happening in a way that attracts attention and energy
examples: The club was poppin with great music tonight
Her poppin outfit turned heads at the party

definitions: inhabited or occupied by people or other living things in a particular area
examples: The densely populated city had traffic problems
The newly populated island developed quickly

definitions: having a large population relative to the area in a crowded condition
examples: China is the world's most populous country
The populous metropolitan area needed more infrastructure

definitions: containing or depicting explicit sexual material intended to stimulate erotic feelings
examples: The pornographic material was confiscated by authorities
The movie received a pornographic rating

definitions: having minute spaces or holes through which liquid or air may pass
examples: The porous rock absorbed water like a sponge
Her porous skin required special moisturizer

definitions: able to be easily carried or moved from place to place
examples: The portable computer fit in her backpack
We brought a portable grill to the picnic

definitions: depicted, described, or represented in a particular way in art or media
examples: The actor portrayed a troubled teenager brilliantly
The media portrayed him as a villain

definitions: positioned artificially for artistic or photographic purposes
presented or existing in a specified way that may be artificial
examples: The posed photograph looked unnatural
Models posed for the fashion shoot
The posed question challenged their assumptions
He posed a serious threat to security

definitions: elegant, stylishly luxurious, and expensive in a way associated with wealth
examples: They dined at a posh restaurant downtown
Her posh accent revealed her privileged background

definitions: relating to or determined by position or placement in space or hierarchy
examples: The player's positional awareness helped the team
Positional changes affected the company structure

definitions: relating to the act of putting something in a particular place or arrangement strategically
examples: The positioning strategy targeted young consumers
Careful positioning of furniture maximized space

definitions: owned, controlled, or influenced by someone as their property or under their power
controlled by an evil spirit or supernatural force in behavior or actions
examples: She possessed great wealth and property
The knowledge he possessed was invaluable
The possessed child spoke in strange voices
They believed she was possessed by demons

definitions: showing ownership or the relationship of belonging in grammar or behavior
demanding someone's total attention and love in a way that prevents independence
examples: The possessive pronoun 'my' shows ownership
His possessive attitude toward property was obvious
Her possessive boyfriend checked her phone constantly
The possessive mother wouldn't let her child play alone

definitions: relating to the public service or system of collecting and delivering mail
examples: The postal worker delivered packages daily
New postal regulations affected shipping costs

definitions: relating to academic work or research done after receiving a doctoral degree
examples: She received a postdoctoral fellowship at Harvard
His postdoctoral research focused on climate change

definitions: displayed or published in a public place or online for people to see
assigned or stationed at a particular place or position officially
examples: The posted sign warned of construction ahead
She posted photos on social media
Soldiers were posted at the border
The guard posted at the entrance checked IDs

definitions: situated behind or at the rear of something in anatomy or position
coming after in time or order compared to something else
examples: The posterior part of the brain controls vision
The horse's posterior legs were injured
His posterior analysis proved more accurate
The posterior events confirmed her predictions

definitions: relating to or denoting a course of study undertaken after completing a bachelor's degree
examples: She enrolled in postgraduate studies in psychology
The postgraduate program required two years

definitions: occurring, awarded, or appearing after the death of the person involved
examples: The author received posthumous recognition for her work
His posthumous album topped the charts

definitions: relating to or occurring in the time after menopause has taken place in women
examples: Postmenopausal women may need calcium supplements
The study focused on postmenopausal health issues

definitions: relating to or characteristic of postmodernism in art, architecture, or criticism after modernism
examples: The postmodern building mixed various architectural styles
Her postmodern novel challenged traditional narrative

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the postmodernist movement in arts and philosophy
examples: The postmodernist artist rejected absolute truth
Postmodernist architecture often uses irony and pluralism

definitions: relating to or denoting an examination or analysis after death or after an event
examples: The postmortem examination revealed the cause of death
They conducted a postmortem analysis of the failed project
